de.hshl.obj.loader

Class DecodingException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • de.hshl.obj.loader.DecodingException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DecodingException.ConversionException, DecodingException.NotSupported

    public class DecodingException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    Indicates that decoding a file has gone wrong and the process has been aborted. May for example indicate a syntax error in the *.obj or *.mtl resource, or an invalid order of wavefront statements.

    At the top level inside the OBJLoader and MTLLoader, any DecodingException will be wrapped inside an IOException. That way, users only have to catch IOExceptions and will receive detailed information from the DecodingException nonetheless.

    DecodingException.ConversionExceptions are a special kind of DecodingExceptions, which occur when the raw file data is converted to clean Java data structures. This may be caused by missing information or inconsistent data.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
